summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting a video conference interview conducted on May 31, 2022, with a Medical Examiner from the New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner regarding the autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein. The interview was part of an OIG investigation into Epstein's death by hanging in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York on August 10, 2019.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center New York, New York (MCC New York)
Special Housing Unit (SHU) within MCC New York
New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME), New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is part of an official OIG investigation (Case Number: 2019-010614) into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein was found hanged in his assigned cell (SHU Cell 220) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York on August 10, 2019.
A Medical Examiner from the NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner conducted Epstein's autopsy on August 11, 2019.
The OIG interviewed that Medical Examiner via video conference on May 31, 2022, and the interview was recorded and transcribed.
Attachments to the report include the autopsy report, pictures of the cell, and pictures of the ligature collected as evidence.
